definition: marked by temperance in indulgence, with few burdens, any device serving as a source of illumination, make lighter or brighter
details:
adjective
- marked by temperance in indulgence
= synonyms: abstemious
- characterized by or emitting light
= example: characterized by or emitting light
- casual and unrestrained in sexual behavior
= synonyms: easy
- with regard to color, having a relatively small amount of coloring agent
= example: with regard to color, having a relatively small amount of coloring agent
= synonyms: light-colored
- (used of soil) loose and large-grained in consistency
= example: (used of soil) loose and large-grained in consistency
- (of sleep) easily disturbed
= example: (of sleep) easily disturbed
= synonyms: wakeful
- demanding little effort
- having relatively few calories
= synonyms: lite, low-cal, calorie-free
- easily assimilated in the alimentary canal
- of comparatively little physical weight or density
= example: of comparatively little physical weight or density
- designed for ease of movement or to carry little weight
= example: designed for ease of movement or to carry little weight
- psychologically light
- not great in degree or quantity or number
= example: not great in degree or quantity or number
- (physics, chemistry) not having atomic weight greater than average
= example: (physics, chemistry) not having atomic weight greater than average
- of little intensity or power or force
= example: of little intensity or power or force
- moving easily and quickly
= synonyms: lightsome, tripping
- of the military or industry
= example: of the military or industry
= synonyms: heavy
- (of sound or color) free from anything that dulls or dims
= synonyms: clear
- silly or trivial
= synonyms: idle
- intended primarily as entertainment
- having little importance
= example: having little importance
- (used of vowels or syllables) pronounced with little or no stress
= example: (used of vowels or syllables) pronounced with little or no stress
= synonyms: weak, unaccented
- less than the correct or legal or full amount often deliberately so
= example: less than the correct or legal or full amount often deliberately so
= synonyms: short
- very thin and insubstantial
- weak and likely to lose consciousness
= synonyms: faint, light-headed, lightheaded, swooning
adverb
- with few burdens
= example: with few burdens
= synonyms: lightly
noun
- any device serving as a source of illumination
= example: any device serving as a source of illumination
= synonyms: light source
- a device for lighting or igniting fuel or charges or fires
= example: a device for lighting or igniting fuel or charges or fires
= synonyms: lighter
- the visual effect of illumination on objects or scenes as created in pictures
= example: the visual effect of illumination on objects or scenes as created in pictures
= synonyms: lightness
- merriment expressed by a brightness or gleam or animation of countenance
= synonyms: sparkle, twinkle, spark
- the quality of being luminous
= example: the quality of being luminous
= synonyms: brightness, luminosity, brightness level, luminance, luminousness
- public awareness
= example: public awareness
- mental understanding as an enlightening experience
= example: mental understanding as an enlightening experience
- a particular perspective or aspect of a situation
= example: a particular perspective or aspect of a situation
- a visual warning signal
= example: a visual warning signal
- an illuminated area
= example: an illuminated area
- a person regarded very fondly
= example: a person regarded very fondly
- (physics) electromagnetic radiation that can produce a visual sensation
= example: (physics) electromagnetic radiation that can produce a visual sensation
= synonyms: visible radiation
- having abundant light or illumination
= example: having abundant light or illumination
= synonyms: lighting
- a condition of spiritual awareness
= synonyms: illumination
verb
- make lighter or brighter
= example: make lighter or brighter
= synonyms: lighten, illume, illumine, light up, illuminate, lighten up, brighten
- begin to smoke
= synonyms: light up, fire up
- alight from (a horse)
= synonyms: dismount
- to come to rest, settle
= example: to come to rest, settle
= synonyms: perch, alight
- fall to somebody by assignment or lot
= synonyms: fall
- cause to start burning
= synonyms: inflame, enkindle, kindle, ignite, conflagrate
